description.S1: Help Junlei Tennyson fix the radiator arrays in the maintenance shaft.

blurb.B1: Speaking to Junlei Tennyson about why the ship seems extraordinarily warm will reveal that Groundbreaker's radiators need replacement parts to prevent them from continuing to dump super-heated air onto the ship.
blurb.B2: Junlei has been unable to get new parts as the Board is refusing to part with any for a fair price.
blurb.B3: Offering to assist with the situation will start the quest.
blurb.B4: Junlei will tell the Stranger that spare radiator parts can likely be found in the ship's Back Bays -
blurb.B5: an abandoned area on a lower deck which is now inhabited by crazed outlaws.
blurb.B6: She asks the Stranger to retrieve the parts by whatever means is necessary,
blurb.B8: If asked, she will also explain that she previously sent an engineer with a small security detail to retrieve the parts,

O1.summary: Get New Parts for the Radiators

description.S1: You need to get new parts for the Radiator Array to keep the Groundbreaker from overheating.
description.S2: Junlei wants you to salvage the parts for the radiators from old machinery in the back bays.

blurb.B1: Travel to the Back Bays using the elevator directly opposite Engineering.
blurb.B3: the Stranger will be confronted by Captain MacRedd,
blurb.B4: a crazed outlaw leader and self-proclaimed "king".
blurb.B6: each of which will allow the Stranger to pass through the Back Bays and retrieve the parts:
blurb.B7: Attack and kill MacRedd and his outlaws.
blurb.B8: With Persuade 40 or Intimidate 40, MacRedd will ask for tribute in exchange for the parts.
blurb.B9: Lie 40 can be used to lie about the parts leaking deadly toxins,
blurb.B10: or he can be bribed with 630 bits.
blurb.B11: With Felix in your party MacRedd will only need to be bribed.
blurb.B12: The spare parts are located on the upper level of the Back Bays.

dialog.speaker: JunleiTennyson (Female)
dialog.utterance: Captain. What can I do for you?

dialog.speaker: Player
dialog.utterance: I heard you're having a heat problem. What's going on?

dialog.speaker: Player
dialog.utterance: What's it like being in command around here?

dialog.speaker: Player
dialog.utterance: You don't have a lot of faith in the Board.

dialog.speaker: JunleiTennyson (Female)
dialog.utterance: Groundbreaker's radiators need replacement parts. They're dumping super-heated air into my ship.

dialog.speaker: Player
dialog.utterance: Why haven't you fixed them yet?

dialog.speaker: Player
dialog.utterance: I'm sure your capable staff can stay ahead of the problem.

dialog.speaker: JunleiTennyson (Female)
dialog.utterance: Only the Board has access to new parts, and I won't let them swindle me into a corner.

dialog.speaker: Player
dialog.utterance: Is there no room for compromise?

dialog.speaker: Player
dialog.utterance: Surely the Board doesn't want Groundbreaker to roast?

dialog.speaker: JunleiTennyson (Female)
dialog.utterance: None. Every time I give in to the Board, Groundbreaker loses its freedom. Soon there won't be anything left. I can't allow that.

dialog.speaker: JunleiTennyson (Female)
dialog.utterance: The Board isn't helping and my resources are spread thin. If I don't get those radiators back online, Groundbreaker - everyone aboard - will be cooked alive.

dialog.speaker: Player
dialog.utterance: You need a contractor to work this out. I'm available for a reasonable rate.

dialog.speaker: Player
dialog.utterance: Is there a way I can help?

dialog.speaker: Player
dialog.utterance: How do the heat radiators work?

dialog.speaker: JunleiTennyson (Female)
dialog.utterance: "Reasonable," huh? That's the best news I've heard all day.

dialog.speaker: JunleiTennyson (Female)
dialog.utterance: According to my grandmother's old schematics, the parts we need should be in the Back Bays.

dialog.speaker: Player
dialog.utterance: Got it. I'll take care of that right now.

dialog.speaker: Player
dialog.utterance: That abandoned deck down below? I've been there.

dialog.speaker: Player
dialog.utterance: How do you know that the parts are still there?

dialog.speaker: Player
dialog.utterance: But there's a catch, right?

dialog.speaker: JunleiTennyson (Female)
dialog.utterance: Hold on. There's something you should know before you go charging off.

dialog.speaker: JunleiTennyson (Female)
dialog.utterance: The Back Bays are on a lower deck, long abandoned, and a haven for miscreants now.

dialog.speaker: Player
dialog.utterance: I'll get you those parts from the Back Bays.

dialog.speaker: Player
dialog.utterance: You can't get these parts anywhere else?

dialog.speaker: JunleiTennyson (Female)
dialog.utterance: Good. Once you've obtained the parts, we can proceed to the next phase of repairs.

dialog.speaker: JunleiTennyson (Female)
dialog.utterance: You must not have been here long. In Halcyon, new parts come by way of interstellar freighters from Earth, and the Board monopolizes that kind of trade.

dialog.speaker: JunleiTennyson (Female)
dialog.utterance: That means I'd have to negotiate with the Board. I've already given them the shops, the docking fees, and a damn embassy.

dialog.speaker: Player
dialog.utterance: Their "negotiations" sound like a bureaucratic coup.

dialog.speaker: Player
dialog.utterance: Aren't you just delaying the inevitable by cannibalising Groundbreaker's systems?

dialog.speaker: JunleiTennyson (Female)
dialog.utterance: Damn right. And while I'm Captain of the Groundbreaker, it falls to me to preserve this ship's independence.

dialog.speaker: JunleiTennyson (Female)
dialog.utterance: Fatalism has got no home on Groundbreaker. We aim to weather the storm, no matter how bad it gets.

dialog.speaker: JunleiTennyson (Female)
dialog.utterance: Between us Captains, I try to avoid sounding as bleak as you. Even if I'm feeling down, the crew doesn't need to hear it.

dialog.speaker: JunleiTennyson (Female)
dialog.utterance: Then you know it's a den of criminals and miscreants. Unfortunately, I'll need to ask you to return.

dialog.speaker: JunleiTennyson (Female)
dialog.utterance: I keep diligent records of station repairs, requisitions, and available assets. Just like my grandmother taught me.

dialog.speaker: JunleiTennyson (Female)
dialog.utterance: The station's radiators haven't changed since her time, and her records say the parts should be there. I trust them.

dialog.speaker: JunleiTennyson (Female)
dialog.utterance: I- we'd be grateful for your assistance.

dialog.speaker: JunleiTennyson (Female)
dialog.utterance: A simple question with a complicated answer, one that I unfortunately don't have time to give. Not with our situation being so dire.

dialog.speaker: JunleiTennyson (Female)
dialog.utterance: They want us to sweat, thinking that'll soften me up for a bad faith deal. If you'll excuse me, they can go fuck themselves.

dialog.speaker: JunleiTennyson (Female)
dialog.utterance: My engineers have managed to keep the heat to livable levels, but all the fixes are temporary. This wound is bound to fester.

dialog.speaker: JunleiTennyson (Female)
dialog.utterance: Frustrating. Everything down to the circuitboards is past warranty, so I have the pleasure of making life or death decisions on a shoestring budget.

dialog.speaker: JunleiTennyson (Female)
dialog.utterance: Plus there's no time to train my successor or document fixes in a way that anyone outside the family would understand.

dialog.speaker: Player
dialog.utterance: This ship is a family business?

dialog.speaker: Player
dialog.utterance: Aren't you a little young to be training a successor?

dialog.speaker: Player
dialog.utterance: Back to my other questions.

dialog.speaker: JunleiTennyson (Female)
dialog.utterance: Sure is. The Tennysons came over on the Groundbreaker. My grandmother, Chief Guiying, kept it together during the Crossing and until she died.

dialog.speaker: JunleiTennyson (Female)
dialog.utterance: I was... "promoted" only recently. When my mom died. Then I took the leap from Chief Engineer to Captain.

dialog.speaker: JunleiTennyson (Female)
dialog.utterance: Maybe you can see why I'm protective of Groundbreaker. This ship is family. It's got tinkerings and bypasses that only Tennysons know about.

dialog.speaker: Player
dialog.utterance: Was it a big change, that transition to command?

dialog.speaker: Player
dialog.utterance: Condolences, Junlei. I'm sure those were some big shoes to fill.

dialog.speaker: JunleiTennyson (Female)
dialog.utterance: It was different knowing that I couldn't turn to anyone who could answer the tough questions for me.

dialog.speaker: JunleiTennyson (Female)
dialog.utterance: Appreciate it. There wasn't much that took me by surprise about the job, but the little things you never expect or think about? They add up over time.

dialog.speaker: JunleiTennyson (Female)
dialog.utterance: You see any bite-sized Tennyson children running around? I didn't think so.

dialog.speaker: JunleiTennyson (Female)
dialog.utterance: The next Captain won't have my heritage. I'll have to foster that talent from somewhere. It's only a question of when.

dialog.speaker: JunleiTennyson (Female)
dialog.utterance: You've got my attention.

dialog.speaker: JunleiTennyson (Female)
dialog.utterance: You're right, I don't. The Board is after two things - bits and power. And they only get it by sticking their nose where it doesn't belong.

dialog.speaker: Player
dialog.utterance: How do you keep the Board at a safe distance?

dialog.speaker: Player
dialog.utterance: Back to my other questions.

dialog.speaker: JunleiTennyson (Female)
dialog.utterance: I placate them when I have something to offer, but I can also be a real hard-ass. It'd be a joy if I could kick out the corporate merchants and reclaim the docking fees in my lifetime.

dialog.speaker: JunleiTennyson (Female)
dialog.utterance: Too much of Groundbreaker's income is flowing in the wrong direction. I'd like to see that change.
